vulnerability.name: USN-4308-2
vulnerability.description: USN-4308-1 fixed several vulnerabilities in Twisted. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 14.04 ESM.  Original advisory details:   it was discovered that Twisted incorrectly validated or sanitized certain  URIs or HTTP methods. A remote attacker could use this issue to inject  invalid characters and possibly perform header injection attacks.  (CVE-2019-12387)   It was discovered that Twisted incorrectly verified XMPP TLS certificates.  A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to perform a  machine-in-the-middle attack and obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2019-12855)   Jake Miller and ZeddYu Lu discovered that Twisted incorrectly handled  certain content-length headers. A remote attacker could possibly use this  issue to perform HTTP request splitting attacks. (CVE-2020-10108,  CVE-2020-10109)

statements.status_notes: Several security issues were fixed in Twisted. Available with Ubuntu Pro.
